newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares slump after New York fall.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares slump after New York fall.

text.p: Swedish shares fell sharply towards the end of the session on Friday as Wall Street opened in a bad mood and shares tumbled in the last 90 minutes of trading.
The OMX Index fell 1.97 percent to 2,553.23, pulling back at the close after having been down 2.8 percent shortly after Wall Street opened with a hangover.
The bank and insurance sector was the weakest of the day in Sweden, falling 2.6 percent.
"The banks had been in demand earlier because of all the rumours about restructuring and I think investors will be scared off by the increase in rates in the U.S.," one broker said.
Insurer Trygg Hansa bucked the trend, rising 2.0 crowns to 169.50 crowns.
Falls were across the board, with majors Ericsson, down 6.5 to 348.5, and Astra, down 2.5 to 134, accounting for a large chunk of the 5.5 billion crown turnover.
